content: nestoria is a simple drop shoulder sweater worked from the top down with special twisted rib details it starts with the shoulders shaped with german short row then the upper body is worked flat with a round neck shaping the body is then joined in the round and worked to the hem sleeves are picked up around the armholes and worked in the round downwards with decreases to taper them until the cuffs finally the collar is picked up around the neckline and worked as a wide mock-turtleneck this beginner friendly sweater is a blank palette for any special yarn it s an easy relaxing knit that gives the basis of top-down drop shoulder constructions links to video tutorials are provided for the required specific techniques such as cast-on methods and short-row **sizes ** 1 2 / 3 / 4 / 5 6 / 7 / 8 / 9 all measurements are those of the finished sweater see last pictures for schematic and complete measurements finished bust circ 90 100 / 110 / 120 / 130 140 / 150 / 160 / 170 cm 35 ½ 39 ¼ / 43 ¼ / 47 ¼ / 51 ¼ 55 / 59 / 63 / 67 *if you need a smaller or larger size please let me know before purchasing the pattern so i can grade it for you * choose a size with up to 20 cm 7 ¾ positive ease at bust shown in size 3 on a 90 cm 35 ½ bust **yarn ** you will need 900 950 / 1000 / 1100 / 1250 1400 / 1550 / 1650 / 1700 meters 985 1040 / 1095 / 1205 / 1370 1535 / 1695 / 1805 / 1860 yards of dk weight yarn the sample was knit with katia yarns concept yoga in 201 *note though the yarn used in the sample classifies as aran weight it is a chainette type yarn it has a higher meterage / yardage to weight ratio and makes a very light fabric if substituting for a classic yarn structure make sure to go for a dk weight * **needles ** main fabric 4 mm us 6 circular needles with appropriate length to knit in the round and magic loop or dpns ribbing 3 5 mm us 4 circular needles with appropriate length to knit in the round and magic loop or dpns or size required to get gauge **gauge ** 20 sts x 25 rnds per 10 cm 4 with larger needles in stockinette after blocking **notions ** stitch markers tapestry needle and scissors scrap yarn to place sts on hold row counter recommended **techniques used ** top down drop shoulder sweater german short row on the shoulders knitted-on cast-on and simple make one increases to shape the rounded neckline picking up stitches backward loops cast-on for the underarm body worked straight in the round simple decreases for tapered sleeves twisted ribbing pattern includes written instructions
